bibl.note: This document is a letter from Francis Duffy to Adam Fergusson in Carthage, TN, dated April 12, 1845. Duffy writes in response to a request by Fergusson to remove the current Post Master of Fergusson's area. Duffy concurs that such a removal is desirable.

div1.p: your favour of the 3rd Inst. was recd. on the subject of Post Master at your place I am for the removal of the present incumbent at your Town The Democracy is at present responsable for the Just fair and Equitable administration of their Goverment this Cannot be Carried out without the aid and hearty Cooperation of true Democrats in Every department I doubt the policy of removeals to any great Extent untill after August Then no harm Can Result But so far as you are Concerned at Carthage I shall aid you at any time I shall be pleased to hear from you on the subject at any time

closer.salute: I am Very Respectfully your Obt Sevt. &C
